contentrichtext.text: {{Other uses|Ikawa (disambiguation)}} {{nihongo|'''Ikawa'''|井川町|Ikawa-chō}} was a [[towns of Japan|town]] located in [[Miyoshi District, Tokushima|Miyoshi District]], [[Tokushima Prefecture|Tokushima]], [[Japan]]. On March 1, 2006 Ikawa was merged with the towns of [[Ikeda, Tokushima|Ikeda]], [[Mino, Tokushima|Mino]] and [[Yamashiro, Tokushima|Yamashiro]], and the villages of [[Higashiiyayama, Tokushima|Higashiiyayama]] and [[Nishiiyayama, Tokushima|Nishiiyayama]], all from [[Miyoshi District, Tokushima|Miyoshi District]], to form the new city of [[Miyoshi, Tokushima|Miyoshi]]. As of 2003, the town had an estimated [[population]] of 5,044 and a [[population density|density]] of 113.35 persons per km². The total area was 44.5 km². ==External links== *{{official|http://www.city.tokushima-miyoshi.lg.jp}} {{Ja icon}} [[Category:Dissolved municipalities of Tokushima Prefecture]] {{Tokushima-geo-stub}}
